image.altText: Coastal scene with road in foreground, ocean and headland to left, and green on right, with rocket, buildings seen in distance

props.synopsis: Years of community protesting hasn't stopped SA's planning minister granting final approvals to allow the company behind a rocket launching project to continue with its space exploration mission.

title.children: Rocket launching complex on SA coast given final approval despite environmental concerns

image.altText: Two photos of men side by side speaking in an interview.

props.synopsis: There are two major beneficiaries of the recent turmoil within the South Australian Liberal Party, though it's unlikely either would openly describe themselves that way.

title.children: Why have these two leaders benefited from one party's turmoil?

image.altText: a blonde woman hearing a floral headpiece leans down on a bridled horse and smiles for the photo

props.synopsis: After growing up surrounded by horses and racing, Nicole Wenske took her regional roots to one of Australia's most prominent fashion events, the Melbourne Cup Carnival.

title.children: Country flair on display at Melbourne Cup fashion show

image.altText: Albanese smiles as a crowd surrounding him cheers.

props.synopsis: Labor has promised to bake in fee-free TAFE at a rally setting the party up for the coming federal election, saying if the government is re-elected it will make 100,000 fee-free places permanently available each year,

title.children: Albanese promises to lock in 100,000 fee-free TAFE places every year, in pseudo campaign launch

image.altText: Two fire trucks watering burnt grass on a large paddock

props.synopsis: Two men have been arrested and a family of three have been taken to hospital after a fire burnt through 33 hectares of grass in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Pair facing bushfire-related charges after shed and glasshouses damaged in blaze

image.altText: Aerial close up of aqua water, small whale calf on the left next to a larger whale, both with white patches on heads

props.synopsis: Scientists say southern right whale numbers have recovered in the Great Australian Bight Marine Park, and are now calling for further protection as they move into new areas.

title.children: Southern right whales are in abundance off Australia's south coast, but new threats have emerged

image.altText: A composite image showing aspects of South Australia's late-term abortion debate.

props.synopsis: South Australia's late-term abortion debate has played out inside parliament, on the steps outside the building, and on social media platforms — and campaigner and academic Joanna Howe has been at the centre of that debate.

title.children: How social media has influenced South Australia's debate on abortion

image.altText: Lady with blonde hair wearing a dress and smiling

props.synopsis: Would you travel 900 kilometres just to catch up friends? Meet the women who live in some of Australia's most remote places who do just that.

title.children: Outback women travel hundreds of kilometres to catch up and connect

image.altText: A composite image of five people, four men and a woman. Their faces are in boxes.

props.synopsis: Insiders and whistleblowers are troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people.

title.children: One by one, these insiders left the world's biggest social media companies. They warn safeguards have been 'cut to the bone'

image.altText: A close up of a shiny red quandong fruit growing on a tree

props.synopsis: Quandongs fetch high prices but overcoming inconsistent supply remains a challenge to growing a market.

title.children: Fruit retailing at $100 per kilo has huge demand but farmers are struggling to grow them

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

props.synopsis: Jordan Fineanganofo, 23, pleaded not guilty to six charges including the murder of paramedic Steven Tougher outside a Campbelltown McDonald's in April 2023. Mr Tougher's family wept in a Sydney courtroom while hearing graphic details of the stabbing attack.

title.children: Man charged with murder of paramedic could be found not criminally responsible, court hears

image.altText: Amrita facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: When Amrita moved to Australia with her husband he was "very gentle", but soon after his family was treating her like a servant. New laws are set to finally recognise dowry abuse as a form of domestic violence to help those in similar situations.

title.children: 'Daylight robbery' of dowry abuse leaving women stranded, but new laws offer hope

image.altText: A view of smaoke coming from volcano.

props.synopsis: At least ten people have died after Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki in eastern Indonesia erupts, spewing explosive plumes of lava and forcing authorities to evacuate several nearby villages, officials say.

title.children: Several people killed in Indonesian volcanic eruption

image.altText: A modestly dressed king walks down the high street of a Spanish village with body guards and a crowd surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Residents scream "get out" as King Felipe VI and other officials tour one of the worst-hit areas of flood-ravaged Valencia City.

title.children: Spanish king and queen pelted with mud as locals vent anger over government's flooding response

image.altText: Leigh Haussen practices his bounce before and AFL match in the centre of the field

props.synopsis: AFL field umpire Leigh Haussen will not be eligible to officiate the first round of the 2025 AFL season after he dressed as Osama bin Laden at an end of season event.

title.children: AFL umpire banned for 'inappropriate' costume at end of season event

image.altText: A satellite circling the earth.

props.synopsis: A $7 billion plan to create an Australian military-grade satellite communications system announced in April last year has been cancelled as current defence spending is reviewed.

title.children: Major Australian military satellite project axed just 18 months after announcement

image.altText: An image of Chris Ellison superimposed on an image of his mining operations

props.synopsis: The managing director of a major lithium and iron ore company in WA is accused of tax evasion involving offshore companies.

title.children: Mining magnate Chris Ellison to step down over alleged tax evasion

image.altText: A silhouette shows graduate students wearing gowns and hats.

props.synopsis: Economists have welcomed the government's plan to raise the level of income people need to earn before they need to make student debt repayments, but argue that reducing the cost of higher education would have greater benefits than slashing existing debts.

title.children: Government's plan to overhaul student debt repayments receives mixed reception from economists

image.altText: An image of a night sky, lit up by a meteor.

props.synopsis: It will be best viewed late into the evening and early tomorrow morning, but unless you're a night sky enthusiast, then it might not be worth your time.

title.children: Tonight's meteor shower is known for producing very bright fireballs — and you can see it anywhere in Australia

image.altText: 'Corrosive of trust in government': Tony Burke delivers censure motion against Scott Morrison

props.synopsis: Labor frontbencher Murray Watt says Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke has taken "appropriate precautions" since buying a Chinese-made EV, after the matter came up in estimates.

title.children: Home affairs minister takes 'appropriate precautions' over his Chinese EV — as it happened

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: Chris Henggeler is the only grazier in Australia using feral donkeys to regenerate his remote property. Now he's on the wrong side of the law.

title.children: 'He has transformed a desert into an oasis': The defiant grazier running a radical regeneration experiment using feral donkeys

image.altText: A Surf Life Saving rescuer pushing a jetski into the water off the beach.

props.synopsis: The boy was trying to cross a channel of water on the NSW Central Coast with his father and brothers when the current swept him away.

title.children: Search resumes for missing 11yo boy swept out to sea at 'dangerous' channel

image.altText: Maya Rudolph and Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: For 50 years, Saturday Night Live has been at the forefront of US political satire. Here are some of the politicians, presidents and White House hopefuls who have made an appearance.

title.children: Kamala Harris joins line of US politicians appearing on Saturday Night Live

image.altText: A jockey urges his horse to the line in the Melbourne Cup as another horse runs on in the background.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Cup has changed greatly in 30 years, but some things remain the same. Just ask three-time cup-winning jockey Kerrin McEvoy.

title.children: 'It's not irrevocable, but it is a real disadvantage': The evolving tactics of winning the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX has gained 0.6 per cent, while Westpac's profit has slipped and Mineral Resources founder and MD Chris Ellison has been forced to step down early. Look back at the day's events.

title.children: AFP searches PwC's Sydney offices, while ASX gains ahead of RBA rates decision — as it happened

image.altText: a man's silhouette

props.synopsis: He decided tough, decisive and quick action was needed.

title.children: After his son was bullied, this father took out a personal protection order against the teenage perpetrator

image.altText: A child is immunised via droplets into the mouth in a clinic.

props.synopsis: Israel's military denies responsibility for the strike, which occurred during a pause in fighting. UNICEF has described the incident as "disturbing".

title.children: Israeli attacks kill 31 people in Gaza while four children injured in drone strike at polio vaccination centre

image.altText: Alleged NT gunman Matthew Vanko

props.synopsis: Matej-Hoi Tsung Vanko, who was sentenced to life behind bars for murder in 2012, will be unable to apply for parole until September 2036 after pleading guilty to taking part in a riot at Darwin Correctional Centre in 2020.

title.children: Convicted murderer has non-parole period extended after involvement in Darwin prison riot

image.altText: A pod of pilot whales in the water with a medium-sized cruise vessel alongside them.

props.synopsis: Riley Grining was skippering a cruise around Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour on Sunday when he received a call to help stop a pod of pilot whales from stranding themselves on a beach.

title.children: 'It could have been way worse': Boats help shepherd whale pod out of Hells Gates to avoid mass stranding

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: A new poll from a pollster rated among country's most reputable predicts Kamala Harris will claim a surprise victory in Iowa — a state her rival Donald Trump had been expected to win easily — as the US presidential campaign enters its final stages.

title.children: US election 'oracle' predicts surprise for Harris as Trump rails at 'fake' poll

image.altText: Man seen from mouth down sitting with crossed legs with lap-top in lap. He wears shirt and jeans, and has ginger beard.

props.synopsis: Unprecedented legal battles are testing if parent companies of tools like ChatGPT can be liable for defamation when innocent people are incorrectly described as criminals.

title.children: When AI wrongly described this man as a criminal, it thrust him into uncharted legal territory

image.altText: A man casts his vote into a mobile ballot box in his living room.

props.synopsis: Maia Sandu has claimed victory in a tense presidential run-off against pro-Russian rival Alexandr Stoianoglo, with almost 95 per cent of the votes counted.

title.children: Pro-EU incumbent Maia Sandu claims victory in Moldova's presidential election

image.altText: James Van Der Beek revealed he has colorectal cancer, also known as bowel cancer.

props.synopsis: In a statement provided to US media outlet People magazine, the 47-year-old says he has been "privately dealing with this diagnosis".

title.children: Dawson's Creek star James Van Der Beek reveals colorectal cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Woman driving van with dog next to her

props.synopsis: Lesley Larkin's family feels like time is running out to catch her killer as the 40th anniversary of her violent Noosa death approaches.

title.children: 40th anniversary of Lesley Larkin's violent Noosa death approaches, her family remains desperate for answers
